text: When I notice how my behavior affects the team's mood or performance, I adjust my approach to support the group.
I recognize the difference between working next to others and working with them, and I contribute to shared goals.
When I anticipate risks or bottlenecks before they appear, I prepare solutions that help the team stay aligned.
I let my emotions escalate tension or disappear when things get hard, and I react impulsively without thinking about the team's needs.
When I notice unspoken tension or mismatched expectations, I address them with clarity instead of ignoring them.
I recognize when the team needs direction, calm energy, or practical action, and I adjust my contribution accordingly.
When I think ahead about how my actions impact shared goals and workloads, I help prevent chaos and uncertainty.
I let conflict or unclear moments pull me into drama or unproductive debates without managing my focus or energy.
When I respond instead of react, and I listen instead of defend, I create a stabilizing force for the team.
I recognize when to step back and let someone else use a strength I don't have, creating balanced collaboration.
When I match my strengths to team gaps, I create more impact with less effort and multiply group performance.
I try to handle everything alone or wait for someone else to step in, and I don't bring clarity about my strengths and limitations.
When I observe the group dynamic and see how individual behaviors influence team performance, I spot risks earlier.
I recognize when tension rises, and I choose a response that calms the system instead of reacting to it.
When I plan not only the work but the interactions and communication flow, I increase team efficiency.
I let my presence create friction without noticing, and I operate unconsciously instead of playing with intention.
When I understand what the team needs to succeed, I shift from being a task follower to a team contributor.
I recognize when I need to adjust my behavior to what the situation demandsâ€”leading, following, or staying silent.
When I stay balanced and objective even when the team is stressed or facing conflict, I set the tone for the entire group.
I let my emotional spikes control my responses, and I don't pause before reacting or protect the team from unnecessary tension.
